intro: Myriactis panamensis, commonly known as the Panama myriactis, is a rare flowering plant native to Panama. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
